    Qualification of GSM

    2022-04-19

    Qualification.Rmd

    Testing Environment

    R version 4.1.3 (2022-03-10)

    Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit)

    locale: LC_CTYPE=C.UTF-8, LC_NUMERIC=C, LC_TIME=C.UTF-8, LC_COLLATE=C.UTF-8, LC_MONETARY=C.UTF-8, LC_MESSAGES=C.UTF-8, LC_PAPER=C.UTF-8, LC_NAME=C, LC_ADDRESS=C, LC_TELEPHONE=C, LC_MEASUREMENT=C.UTF-8 and LC_IDENTIFICATION=C

    attached base packages: stats, graphics, grDevices, utils, datasets, methods and base

    other attached packages: pander(v.0.6.5), purrr(v.0.3.4), dplyr(v.1.0.8), knitr(v.1.38) and gsm(v.0.3.0)

    loaded via a namespace (and not attached): Rcpp(v.1.0.8.3), bslib(v.0.3.1), compiler(v.4.1.3), pillar(v.1.7.0), jquerylib(v.0.1.4), tools(v.4.1.3), digest(v.0.6.29), gtable(v.0.3.0), jsonlite(v.1.8.0), evaluate(v.0.15), memoise(v.2.0.1), lifecycle(v.1.0.1), tibble(v.3.1.6), pkgconfig(v.2.0.3), rlang(v.1.0.2), cli(v.3.2.0), yaml(v.2.3.5), pkgdown(v.2.0.2), xfun(v.0.30), fastmap(v.1.1.0), stringr(v.1.4.0), desc(v.1.4.1), generics(v.0.1.2), fs(v.1.5.2), sass(v.0.4.1), vctrs(v.0.4.1), systemfonts(v.1.0.4), grid(v.4.1.3), tidyselect(v.1.1.2), rprojroot(v.2.0.3), here(v.1.0.1), fontawesome(v.0.2.2), glue(v.1.6.2), R6(v.2.5.1), lamW(v.2.1.1), textshaping(v.0.3.6), fansi(v.1.0.3), rmarkdown(v.2.13), tidyr(v.1.2.0), ggplot2(v.3.3.5), magrittr(v.2.0.3), backports(v.1.4.1), scales(v.1.2.0), htmltools(v.0.5.2), ellipsis(v.0.3.2), colorspace(v.2.0-3), ragg(v.1.2.2), utf8(v.1.2.2), stringi(v.1.7.6), RcppParallel(v.5.1.5), munsell(v.0.5.0), broom(v.0.8.0), cachem(v.1.0.6) and crayon(v.1.5.1)

    Assessments

    Assessment AE_Assess

    Specifications

    S1_1: Given correct input data an Adverse Event assessment can be done using the poisson method

        Risk: High
    Impact: High
    Tests: T1_1, T1_2, T1_3, T1_4

    S1_2: Given correct input data an Adverse Event assessment can be done using the wilcoxon method

        Risk: High
    Impact: High
    Tests: T1_5, T1_6, T1_7, T1_8

    S1_3: Assessments are correctly grouped by the site variable

        Risk: Low
    Impact: High
    Tests: T1_1, T1_2, T1_3, T1_4, T1_5, T1_6, T1_7, T1_8

    S1_4: Given correct input data flags will correctly be applied to records that meet flagging criteria, including custom thresholding

        Risk: Medium
    Impact: High
    Tests: T1_1, T1_2, T1_3, T1_4, T1_5, T1_6, T1_7, T1_8

    S1_5: Given subset input data an Adverse Event assessment can be done

        Risk: Medium
    Impact: Medium
    Tests: T1_3, T1_4, T1_7, T1_8

    S1_6: An Adverse Event assessment can be done iteratively by looping over a categorical variable

        Risk: Low
    Impact: Medium
    Tests: T1_4, T1_8

    S1_7: Ensure that missing and invalid data are handled correctly

    Risk: Low
    Impact: Medium
    Tests: T1_9

    Traceability Matrix

    ID T1_1 T1_2 T1_3 T1_4 T1_5 T1_6 T1_7 T1_8 T1_9
    S1_1 X X X X
    S1_2 X X X X
    S1_3 X X X X X X X X
    S1_4 X X X X X X X X
    S1_5 X X X X
    S1_6 X X
    S1_7 X

    Test Cases

    Tests Description Outcome
    T1_1 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the poisson test grouped by the study variable when given correct input data from safetyData and the results should be flagged correctly. success
    T1_2 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the poisson test grouped by the study variable when given correct input data from clindata and the results should be flagged correctly using a custom threshold success
    T1_3 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the poisson test grouped by the study variable when given subset input data from clindata and the results should be flagged correctly. success
    T1_4 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the poisson test grouped by the study variable and the results should be flagged correctly when done in an iterative loop success
    T1_5 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the wilcoxon test grouped by the study variable when given correct input data from safetyData and the results should be flagged correctly. success
    T1_6 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the wilcoxon test grouped by the study variable when given correct input data from clindata and the results should be flagged correctly using a custom threshold. success
    T1_7 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the wilcoxon test grouped by the study variable when given subset input data from clindata and the results should be flagged correctly. success
    T1_8 AE assessment can return a correctly assessed data frame for the wilcoxon test grouped by the study variable and the results should be flagged correctly when done in an iterative loop success
    T1_9 Test that (NA, NaN) in input exposure data throws a warning and drops the participant(s) from the analysis. success

    Assessment Consent_Assess

    Specifications

    S4_1: Given correct input data a Consent assessment can be done

        Risk: High
    Impact: High
    Tests: T4_1, T4_2, T4_3

        Risk: Low
    Impact: High

    Risk: Medium
    Impact: Medium
    Tests: T4_2

    Risk: Low
    Impact: Medium

    Assessment PD_Assess

    Specifications

    S2_1: Given correct input data a Protocol Deviation assessment can be done using the poisson method

        Risk: High
    Impact: High
    Tests: T2_1, T2_2, T2_3

    S2_2: Given correct input data a Protocol Deviation assessment can be done using the wilcoxon method

        Risk: High
    Impact: High
    Tests: T2_4, T2_5, T2_6

    S2_3: Assessments are correctly grouped by the site variable

        Risk: Low
    Impact: High
    Tests: T2_1, T2_2, T2_3, T2_4, T2_5, T2_6

    S2_4: Given correct input data flags will correctly be applied to records that meet flagging criteria, including custom thresholding

        Risk: Medium
    Impact: High
    Tests: T2_1, T2_2, T2_3, T2_4, T2_5, T2_6

    S2_5: Given subset input data a Protocol Deviation assessment can be done

        Risk: Medium
    Impact: Medium
    Tests: T2_2, T2_5

    S2_6: A Protocol Deviation assessment can be done iteratively by looping over a categorical variable

        Risk: Low
    Impact: Medium

    Risk: Low
    Impact: Medium
